reviews.review_msg: Very very good TA. He explains the lab and procedures really clearly. If you're half awake when he explains, you'll still understand. Really guides you on what you should study for the midterms and finals. Really approachable and is really more of a friend than a TA. Would definitely try to get him a TA again if I have the chance. Really funny too!
This prof is horrible, I would recommend that you not take classes with this prof, you will regret it. The class is difficult, and the prof is so biased. He does not even care about you.
so much memorization for exams but the labs were pretty easy. the weekly quizzes could be tricky but not too bad. the exams were very difficult

Voice is kinda dull so it was easy to zone out, but always tried to elaborate on stuff to be engaging and never just read off his slides. Had iClicker for attendance and participation to encourage ppl to show up. Grading was spread out over a lot of things. No complaints about Ryan, I just disliked the course itself. Lots of content and terminology

TBH. RUN. Take it with Jim carter. Ryan only talks about his kids, very monotone and puts u to sleep. The TAs for this course are always hit or miss. Im a bpk major and tbh now i wanna transfer out because ryan was awful. Very vague abt exams, rude and not worth it. Jim carter was a guest for a lecture. I learned more from Jim in one lesson.
Awesome professor. Answers all the questions and is pretty nice. Study hard and read all the lecture slides!

I LOVED this course and Dr. Dill's lectures! Note, lectures are heavy 70-90 slides and all slides are examable. Make time to go through the lecture to prep for exams, and understand the concepts to allocate time to memorize the nuances and details (which are on the exams). Make time to review the anatomy portion every week and you'll be okay.

He is a very tough marker, as you were docked for minor spelling mistakes. Lots of mesmerization as both the lectures and labs were heavy. Would not recommend taking it with him unless you are planning to study a lottttttttt.

Ryan is very good at lecturing and explaining concepts. However, he rarely replies to emails, and his exam answer keys are COMPLETELY unfair. Your answer could be completely right, but he will mark it wrong because it isn't his exact wording on the slides. The content is hard, and that's not his fault. BUT he could be a little more understanding.
